paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (hATTR) with cardiac involvement

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac amyloidosis with heart failure symptoms.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 presented with heart failure symptoms at age 62.
Patient P2 was diagnosed with severe cardiac involvement at age 69.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No symptoms observed, monitored for progression.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P3 remains asymptomatic at age 72.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac amyloidosis with significant diastolic dysfunction.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P4 showed significant diastolic dysfunction at diagnosis.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile variant destabilizes TTR tetramers, leading to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with hATTR.
variants.population_frequency: Rare in general population, higher prevalence in specific ethnic groups.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple studies.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is commonly associated with familial amyloid cardiomyopathy.
key_quotes: The Val122Ile variant is a well-known pathogenic mutation associated with hATTR.
Patients with this variant often present with cardiac symptoms in their 60s.

tables_processed.table_caption: Variants in the TTR gene associated with cardiac amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was clearly presented in the main text and tables.
